title: Will there be another series of Bake Off and will the judges return?
text:
Will the bake off judges be back for seconds in 2020?(Picture: Bourdillon/ Channel 4)

Great British Bake Off season 10 serves up its final treat tonight.

The finale will see another choux champion be crowned, joining the likes of past winners Rahul Mandal and Nadiya Hussain.

Will the kitchen be closed after tonight’s episode or will Bake Off be back?

Will Bake Off be back for a new series?

Fortunately for Bake Off fans, the show is coming back for an 11th season.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Not much has been revealed except the fact that producers have opened online applications for hopeful bakers.

Advertisement

Advertisement

How to apply for Bake Off

If you have dreams of whipping up a masterpiece in the tent, head to the application page online and follow the steps.

To be able to apply you must:

Be 16 or over on 1 January 2020

Be a resident of the UK (including Isle of Man and Channel Islands)

Commit to all the filming days required for the Programme, between April and July 2020.

Not have worked as a full time chef or baker before

Not have an NVQ or other qualification in baking, cooking, food production, catering or food preparation – unless you got these over 10 years ago.

Be able to commit to all filming days – these will be confirmed if your application is successful.

Not be closely related to a member of the Channel 4 or Love Productions – or anyone else involved in the programme

Will the judges return for the new series of Bake Off?

Nothing has been announced yet and little is known about what GBBO 2020 will look like.

It’ll likely come back exactly as we know and love it, but if the show decides to rebrand ‘Prue Paul’s Dough Race,’ that’s just the way the cookie crumbles.

The 2019 finalists (Picture: Love Productions)

The show bosses waited until summer 2019 to confirm the Noel, Sandi, Paul and Prue would all be returning with an Alice in Wonderland teaser so the same could be expected for the 2020 season.

Based on comments Prue has made in the past, it would be shocking if she didn’t return – that’s if fans can forgive her for her Baklava remarks.

Advertisement

Advertisement

She told The Mirror earlier this year: ‘I just want to at least equal Mary Berry, she did seven years. I’ve got another four years to go.’

Noel Fielding recently signed up as a guest judge for Comedy Central’s Roast Battle UK so it’s unclear whether he’ll continue to present the baking show as well as giving celebrities their just desserts in the ‘roast’ battles – where celebs will playfully insult each other.

Could there be more sweethearts made as well as sweet treats? Will Paul Hollywood be back for more innuendos about big organs? Only time will tell.

The Great British Bake Off finale airs tonight at 8pm on Channel 4.

description: With Great British Bake Off 2019 coming to an end, fans are wondering if there will be a new series of Bake Off next year. Find out here...
